subject: Management
title: Equal Talk Time
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Equal Talk Time.

hook.text: In a 60-minute meeting, one person talked for 40 minutes. Four others split the remaining 20.

buildup.text: When one person dominates, the team's collective intelligence drops to that one brain.

discovery.text: Google's Project Aristotle found equal conversational turn-taking is a key indicator of smart teams.

twist.text: It's not about clocking minutes precisely. It's about ensuring every voice is heard over time.

climax.text: Facilitation helps: round-robins, written inputs before discussion, and active invitation of quiet members.

punchline.text: The team's IQ rises when everyone gets airtime.

quiz.question: Why does equal talk time matter for team intelligence?
options: It leverages the full collective brain rather than just one person's
It ensures meetings take exactly the planned duration
Only the most vocal members have valuable contributions
